markdownRemark.html:
Install gh-pages package

Add a deploy script to package.json e.g.

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "deploy": "gatsby build && gh-pages -d public -b master -r https://github.com/username/username.github.io.git",
  }
}

To break that down and explain...

  1. Build it first
  2. Use gh-pages package
  3. Destination folder "public" (what you want to deploy i.e. the built artifacts)
  4. Branch "master" (depends what you set your source in github settings of the repo)
  5. Repo - In my case I wanted to your the github username.github.io repo for the public pages but keep my actual source files in another repo. If you don't do this then gh-pages assumes you're in a git repo and uses the configured "origin".

You can publish to a subdomain and there is additional info on the Gatsby docs site.

frontmatter.title: Publishing your Gatsby site to GitHub Pages
